devdoc.author: Jaan Smith
devdoc.details: A lot of the basic functionality of chess is missing here,  experimentation required to see if this can be done on chain, perhaps oracle nodes instead?

params._blackPlayers: is an array of addresses representing the players for the black pieces
params._blockFactor: represents the amount of blocks that can pass before timing a team out
params._whitePlayers: is an array of addresses representing the players for the white pieces

getCurrentTeamsPlayers().author: Jaan Smith
getCurrentTeamsPlayers().details: May be some bugs lurking in this to do with block validation

returns.turnString: A string representing which colour's turn it is, and The array containing the current team's players whos turn it is

voteTurn(string).author: Jaan Smith
voteTurn(string).details: currently takes any string as on-chain validation is an extension that was not implemented

params._proposedMove: is the FEN representation of the new board state should this turn become validated

devdoc.title: A Class representing a chess game

methods.constructor: Constructor for the ChessGame contract Maximum 4 players per team, initialises external contracts

getBoardState().notice: Returns the FEN representation of the current chess board, from an external contract

getCurrentTeamsPlayers().notice: Returns the object representing the current team's players

voteTurn(string).notice: Provides a proposed move from a particular address, also triggers end of turn and other logic Depending on the state of other variables (e.g. can end a turn based on total votes, or block time)

userdoc.notice: This class does not implement all chess functionality, currently an unoptimised Stub
